result.execSummary:
The defendant Timothy P Russo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Invade Privacy-Pub Place/Person Present (Victim < 18 years old), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 942.08(2)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.  Defendant is NOT eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
Consecutive to: to any other current sentence.

superMiscConds.notes:
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.  Follow any conditions deemed appropriate by Agent.  No contact with any Barnes and Noble stores.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Costs to be paid during term of imprisonment and during Extended Supervision.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

10:50 AM; Case called for Plea/sentencing hearing.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Nesheim in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Timothy P Russo in court, in custody at WCJ (on OTP from Oshkosh Correctional).  Attorney Cassandra A Miller Ms. in court for Timothy P Russo.  Court notes a plea questionnaire has been filed and confirms with counsel parties are prepared to proceed today.  State recites the offer.  Atty. Miller confirms the offer.  Court conducts plea colloquy with the defendant.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1 with the repeater enhancer struck, Court finds defendant guilty. Court will cancel the 8/30/2022 Jury trial and the Defendant may be returned to Oshkosh Correctional.

Sentencing arguments made by the State.
Sentencing arguments made by Atty. Miller.
Defendant presents statements.
Court confirms the State has complied with victim rights to proceed today.

COUNT 1: 
The Court Orders the Following:

Imposed Sentence of:

3 Years Imprisonment (Consecutive to any other current sentence)
-	1 Years of Initial Confinement
-	2 Years of Extended Supervision

Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program
Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
-	Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
-	Follow any conditions deemed appropriate by Agent;
-	No contact with any Barnes and Noble stores.

COSTS:  $268.00;

DNA Surcharge: $250.00;

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

Total costs/fine/forfeiture:  to be paid during term of imprisonment and during extended supervision. Failure to pay;  will result in a civil judgment.
	
Felony warnings, immigration warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Filed by Atty. Miller requesting the matter be set for plea and sentencing.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 26, 2022 at 10:45 am.

10:13 AM; Case called for Jury status hearing.  Attorney Michael Thurston in court for State of Wisconsin.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Nesheim in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Timothy P Russo in court, in custody at WCJ (on OTP from Oshkosh Correctional).  Attorney Cassandra A Miller Ms. in court for Timothy P Russo.   Court notes the matter is set for trial next week and several letters have been filed by the Defendant, which the court has reviewed.  Court notes that as the defendant is represented by Counsel it will not accept the defendant's letter as formal motions noting those need to be filed by his attorney.  Court notes that no formal motion to dismiss has been filed by Atty. Miller and inquires how the matter will be proceeding.  Atty. Miller advises the matter remains unresolved but renews her oral motion to withdraw as counsel and presents statements.  Court inquires of the defendant how he wants to proceed if the court were to grant the motion to withdraw.  Defendant advises he plans to represent himself at the trial next week and confirms he does not want Atty. Miller to continue to represent him.  Atty. Miller believes the defendant should have another attorney appointed and the trial adjourned.  Court responds.  Atty. Miller presents additional statements.  Court again asks if the defendant wants to proceed without counsel.  Defendant advises that he wants an attorney.  Atty. Thurston presents statements and objects to the request for adjournment, and if the court grants Atty. Miller's motion to withdraw the court order she remain on as stand-by counsel for trial.  Atty. Miller presents statements additional statements.  For reasons placed on the record the Court will deny Atty. Miller's renewed motion to withdraw and case will remain as scheduled for jury trial starting 08/30/2022.  Defendant to remain in the custody of the Waukesha County Jail pending resolution of the jury trial set to begin on 08/30/2022.
Waukesha County Jail Inmate Communication Form dated 8/22/22 filed by the defendant re: requesting to have the case dismissed.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 7 Judicial Vacancy, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Letter from clerk to defendant with Judge Lau's response.
from defendant reqeusting the Court dismiss this case. **Reviewed by Judge Lau - No action to be taken by the court.**

Jury status hearing on August 25, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Jury trial - 12 person on August 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.
filed, to be produced from Oshkosh Correctional for the 8/25/2022 Jury status and 8/30/2022 Jury trial.  Defendant to be produced by 8/22/2022 if possible.

08:39 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Timothy P Russo in court by Zoom video means, in custody at Oshkosh Correctional, with attorney Cassandra A Miller.   Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.  Atty. Miller notes at the last hearing she had filed a motion to withdraw as counsel, but since then she has received some correspondence from the defendant and is not sure if she should proceed on her motion or not.  Court inquires if the defendant wants Atty. Miller to continue on as counsel of record.  Defendant advises he does not and wants to resolve the case today; he wants to have the case dismissed and presents additional statements.  Court notes as there is no formal motion to dismiss in the file it cannot address that issue today.  Court notes it first needs to address whether or not Atty. Miller will remain on as counsel of record for the defendant.  Defendant presents statements.  Court will set the matter for jury trial and will keep Atty. Miller on as counsel; counsel agree it should take no more than 2 days.  Court will prepare an OTP from Oshkosh Correctional for the next court dates.  Jury status hearing scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 09:30 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Dated 6/12/22 filed by the defendant re: incorrect name listed for this case.  **Reviewed by Judge Lau - letter will be addressed at next hearing**
Hearing on June 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.

10:59 AM; Case called for Plea/sentencing hearing.   Attorney Cassandra A Miller in court.   Defendant Timothy P Russo did not appear.   Andrew Nesheim appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court notes that the defendant was present on Zoom from Oshkosh Correctional but due to it taking too long to call the case they ended their video.  Court also notes Atty. Miller has just filed a motion to withdraw as counsel.  Atty. Miller confirms and presents statements.  Atty. Miller is asking for a new date to be able to confirm with the defendant that he has no objection to her withdrawing as counsel.  Court will adjourn for further proceedings and to address Atty. Miller's Motion to Withdaw.  Defendant to appear by video from Oshkosh Correctional for the next court date.  Hearing scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Notice of Motion and Motion to Withdraw as Counsel of Record filed by Atty. Miller.

Filed by the defendant re: issues with his name and advising the matter will not be proceeding to sentencing at the next court date.    ** Reviewed by Judge Lau on 5/18/22 - No action to be taken by the court.**

addressed to: Timothy P Russo for hearing on 05/06/22 
Return to Sender, No Longer in Custody, Unable to Forward.

08:44 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Peter G Russo in court, in custody at WCJ (OTP from Oshkosh Correctional), with attorney Cassandra A Miller.   Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court notes there is an amended information to be processed.  Atty. Miller acknowledges receipt, waives reading and enters intial not guilty plea.  Atty. Miller notes today's hearing was set with regards to a prompt disposition request however her client has decided to withdraw the request, the matter can be set for plea and sentencing and the defendant would like to appear by video for that date.  Defendant confirms.  State asks the court to have a formal colloquy with the defendant that he is withdrawing his prompt disposition request.  Court inquires if the request was previously made on the record.  Atty. Miller advises it was.  Court conducts a colloquy with the defendant regarding waiving his prompt disposition demand.  Court finds the defendant is knowingly, voluntarily, and intelligently waiving his prompt diposition request.  Court will adjourn for plea and sentencing.  Defendant to be returned to Oshkosh Correctional.  Defendant to appear by video for the next court date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 2, 2022 at 10:30 am.  Check Case scheduled for May 10, 2022.
Amended Information correcting defendant's name filed by the State.
Hearing on May 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.

09:49 AM Defendant Peter G Russo in court, in custody, with attorney Cassandra A Miller.   Andrew Nesheim appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  City of Brookfield Police Department Officer Bowen Clark sworn in and testifies on direct by Attorney Nesheim.  Cross examination by Attorney Miller.  State rests.  State moves for bind over without argument.  Attorney Miller objects to bind over without argument.  Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.  Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Bail remains as fixed.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.The State brings it to the Court's attention the conversation done off the record regarding a request for a prompt disposition.  Attorney Miller states she needs more time to discuss the prompt disposition with the defendant.  The State and Attorney Miller are requesting a quick date before the Trial Court to allow for Attorney Miller to further discuss the possible request for a prompt disposition.  The Court will schedule this matter for this Friday.  The defendant is to remain at the Waukesha County Jail until the next date.  Hearing scheduled for May 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Returned original warrant from the Waukesha County Sheriff's Department for Peter G. Russo issued on 02-09-2022 by Judge J. Arthur Melvin, III.
Preliminary hearing on May 4, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Detainer placed at: Oshkosh Correctional
filed, to be produced from Oshkosh Correctional

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no unsupervised contact with any child under the age of 18.  Defendant to have no contact with Barnes and Noble listed in the Criminal Complaint.

01:31 PM Defendant Peter G Russo appeared by Zoom, in custody, from Oshkosh Correctional with attorney Cassandra A Miller who appeared by Zoom.   Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Clerk of Courts Office to prepare Order to Produce from Oshkosh Correctional.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 4, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Initial appearance on March 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
